Description: Limestone ostracon: on one side only, a scene in black ink depicting the workman Khnummose adoring the snake-goddess Meresger. The accompanying text also mentions his sons Penniut and Weskhet-nemtet.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: E. Hawkins, 'Tablets and other Egyptian Monuments from the collections of the Earl of Belmore' (London 1843), pl.VIII; K.Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' VII (Oxford 1989), 351-2; Stephen Quirke, 'Ancient Egyptian Religion' (London, 1992), p.15, fig.5
Bibliographic references: Shaw & Nicholson 1995 / British Museum Dictionary of Ancient Egypt (p184)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (395077) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/395077)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
